definition: to die for a good cause
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

pinyin: bu4 cheng2 gong1 bian4 cheng2 ren2

sentences.english: Chengren the success of the General Liming Ding.
Hard Corps is the only way I know.
sentences.chinese: 硬漢團殺身成仁我牢記。

sentences.english: In China's modern history, Tan Sitong's heroic death may be the most exciting event.
sentences.chinese: 譚嗣同的慷慨成仁是中國近代史上最激動人心的華章。

sentences.english: Into the sky , to win or die.
sentences.chinese: 衝向天空，不成功則成仁。

sentences.english: I can get off the publish-or-parish race.
sentences.chinese: 我可以停止不成功便成仁的競爭。

sentences.english: To be able to correlate one's own feelings with those of others may be the way to approach humaneness.
sentences.chinese: 能設身處地換位思維，可以說是找到了成仁的方法”。

sentences.english: One way or another, Kevin Martin pledges to be unrecognizable.
sentences.chinese: 不成功便成仁，凱文馬丁誓言要脫胎換骨。

definition: to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause

pinyin: bu4 cheng2 gong1 bian4 cheng2 ren2

definition: to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
to demonstrate one's sincerity by dying
to be killed for a righteous cause/to die a martyr
to keep going resolutely despite knowing the task is impossible (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 bu4 ke3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: Better broken jade than intact tile./Death is preferable to dishonor. (idiom)
pinyin: ning4 wei2 yu4 sui4 , bu4 wei2 wa3 quan2
